item.title: Microsoft investigates Exchange Online outage in North America
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is working to resolve an ongoing Exchange Online outage affecting customers throughout North America, blocking their access to emails. [...]

item.title: U.S. Senator accuses Microsoft of “gross cybersecurity negligence”
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: U.S. Senator Ron Wyden has sent a letter to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) requesting the agency to investigate Microsoft for failing to provide adequate security in its products, which led to ransomware attacks against healthcare organizations. [...]

item.title: Apple warns customers targeted in recent spyware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple warned customers last week that their devices were targeted in a new series of spyware attacks, according to the French national Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-FR). [...]

item.title: Panama Ministry of Economy discloses breach claimed by INC ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Panama's Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF) has disclosed that one of its computers may have been compromised in a cyberattack.. [...]

item.title: Microsoft adds malicious link warnings to Teams private chats
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft Teams will automatically alert users when they send or receive a private message containing links that are tagged as malicious. [...]

item.title: Akira ransomware exploiting critical SonicWall SSLVPN bug again
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Akira ransomware gang is actively exploiting CVE-2024-40766, a year-old critical-severity access control vulnerability, to gain unauthorized access to SonicWall devices. [...]

item.title: New VMScape attack breaks guest-host isolation on AMD, Intel CPUs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Spectre-like attack dubbed VMScape allows a malicious virtual machine (VM) to leak cryptographic keys from an unmodified QEMU hypervisor process running on modern AMD or Intel CPUs. [...]

item.title: The Buyer’s Guide to Browser Extension Management
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Keep Aware
item.description: Browser extensions boost productivity—but also open the door to hidden risks like data exfiltration and AitM attacks. Keep Aware's Buyer's Guide shows how to gain visibility, enforce policies, and block risky add-ons in real time. [...]

item.title: DDoS defender targeted in 1.5 Bpps denial-of-service attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A DDoS mitigation service provider in Europe was targeted in a massive distributed denial-of-service attack that reached 1.5 billion packets per second. [...]

item.title: Microsoft waives fees for Windows devs publishing to Microsoft Store
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced that, starting today, individual Windows developers will no longer have to pay for publishing their applications on the Microsoft Store. [...]

item.title: Hackers left empty-handed after massive NPM supply-chain attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The largest supply-chain compromise in the history of the NPM ecosystem has impacted roughly 10% of all cloud environments, but attackers made little profit off it. [...]

item.title: Pixel 10 fights AI fakes with new Android photo verification tech
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google is integrating C2PA Content Credentials into the Pixel 10 camera and Google Photos, to help users distinguish between authentic, unaltered images and those generated or edited with artificial intelligence technology. [...]
